com.apriori.concurrent

Class RunnableCompletableFuture<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<T>
      • com.apriori.concurrent.InterruptibleCompletableFuture<T>
        • com.apriori.concurrent.RunnableCompletableFuture<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the future value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CompletionStageFuture<T>, RunnableCompletionStageFuture<T>, Runnable, CompletionStage<T>, Future<T>, RunnableFuture<T>

    public class RunnableCompletableFuture<T>
extends InterruptibleCompletableFuture<T>
implements RunnableCompletionStageFuture<T>
    A completable future that represents a task. The future completes when the task is executed and completes. The future completes with the result of the task or with the cause of its failure.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture

        CompletableFuture.AsynchronousCompletionTask

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new future that represents the given task.

      Interrupts the thread running the task that this future represents, if it is currently running.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RunnableCompletableFuture

        public RunnableCompletableFuture(Callable<T> task)
        Creates a new future that represents the given task. Callers must subsequently arrange for execution by running the new future.
        Parameters:
        task - the task that this future will run and whose result provides the value for this future

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the task associated with this future. When the task completes, the future completes with its result or cause of failure. The task will run at most once. If the task is already running or has already completed or if this future has been cancelled, the method will return immediately.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Specified by:
        run in interface RunnableFuture<T>

      • interrupt

        protected void interrupt()
        Interrupts the thread running the task that this future represents, if it is currently running. If it is not running, this does nothing.
        Overrides:
        interrupt in class InterruptibleCompletableFuture<T>
